forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Rain Showers then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers between 10pm and 4am, then a chance of rain. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. South wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, a gentle interplay of sun and cloud defines the skyline, with a hint of moisture hanging in the air. The chance of rain showers looms, yet for now, a delicate blue peeks between clouds that drift lazily towards the horizon. The temperature hovers around a cool 58 degrees, promising a brisk day that nudges one to dress in layers. A sweater for warmth, perhaps a light jacket for the subtle wind, will keep the chill at bay as the afternoon unfolds.

As twilight approaches, the air cools further, beckoning a slight chance of rain after dark. With wisps of fog lingering, particularly near the Golden Gate, a soft veil offers a quiet charm to evening strolls. That mist carries whispers of the sea, inviting passersby to linger in cafés sipping warm brews or to embrace the crispness on the streets while exploring hidden nooks of the city. Tonight may hold a gentle embrace of rain, but the spirit of exploration remains undampened; the allure of an evening out in this uniquely picturesque setting is enchanting enough to inspire quiet adventure.
